bug.author: vasiloglou
bug.summary: Nearest neighbors with spill trees in dualtree mode does not always return neighbors
bug.description: I have noticed that if the k is big the dual tree algorithm will return max float distances and invalid indices. This probably happens because some leaf nodes do not have enough points

comments.comment: Yes, you are right, I was righting tests for nearest neighbors bindings in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack/pull/1263>#1263</denchmark-link> when I noticed this. As discussed on that pull request, I am working on the solution. :)

For anyone looking to contribute, this is a semi-challenging issue that requires some knowledge of how nearest neighbor works with spill trees. You can reproduce <denchmark-link:https://github.com/vasiloglou>@vasiloglou</denchmark-link> 's original issue by running the following command once you've built mlpack: <denchmark-code>mlpack_knn -i test_data_3_1000.csv --leaf_size 5 -t spill -k 10 -n n.csv -d d.csv -v -a single_tree </denchmark-code>
This runs k-nearest-neighbor search in single-tree mode using spill trees with a leaf size of 5. (So, every leaf in the spill tree contains 5 or fewer points.) But you can see in n.csv and d.csv (the result files), that many of the indices of nearest neighbors are invalid! The reason for this is that the single-tree traverser for spill trees (in src/mlpack/core/tree/spill_tree/spill_single_tree_traverser.hpp), which will be run with Defeatist = true, never actually encounters enough points to add to the results! This is because the algorithm will traverse to the nearest leaf, then run the base cases to find the nearest neighbor. But since leaf_size is only 5, and we are looking for 10 neighbors, we are guaranteed that will find at most 5 nearest neighbors! The task here, then, is to modify the code such that enough results are always returned for the defeatist spill tree single-tree traverser, and the defeatist spill tree dual-tree traverser---the problem also happens when using -a dual_tree.
